Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sarah j
Reviews.Content: Staff was very very nice. Rooms are super comfortable, room service fast fast. Beautiful hotel View is 0 but is expected in that part of town. Will definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In SOHO”
Reviews.Author: Neil K
Reviews.Content: if you like cool but comfortable this is the place. Low key chilled atmosphere with outstanding staff. Just walk out the foot and walk to a million great shops. Have stayed here a bunch and it is always consistent with comfortable beds, nice bathrooms and a cool lobby bar and spectacular rooftop bar. I have sent many friends here and everyone loved it. Tried somewhere else last year and came running back to 60 Thompson.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Eva_Maria_10
Reviews.Content: The 60 Thompson is superbe located in the middle of Soho and it is only a stone throw away from all locations one would want to visit in this area like Prince Street, Spring Street, Greenwich village, Little Italy, Chinatown and so on. The design is comfortable and the staff extremely friendly. Cool bar and nice restaurant Kittichai included. Just make sure your room is not above the bar, otherwise you might fall out of your bed when the crowd parties...

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: KateinNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last week, and although our room was small, this hotel boasts a staff of friendly and helpful people who did all they could to make our stay pleasant! Fun place to stay and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Glamourous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margaret E
Reviews.Content: We had a brief stay here for a splurge and it was perfect, down to the knock on the door with "an amenity"--chocolate chip cookies. Nothing but good things to say about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Happy little Vegemite”
Reviews.Author: Drswoods
Reviews.Content: We wanted a boutique style hotel in Soho for a good price in a good location with good services and staff , and that is what we got. Very happy with the room, staff, breakfast, and bar area. The Thai restaurant was also really good. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age...”
Reviews.Author: city-jaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month and booked with tablet hotels plus. Very hip hotel no doubt, but i felt the service to be lacking a bit. We Were given an upgrade from King bed to 2 double beds??? Never heard that as an upgrade!!! It was the same square feet as the king bed room. We were supposed to get a free amenity (fruit & cheese plate) and room service told us when they get to it they will get to it, when it came up it was the most anemic looking cheese plate I saw. The complimentary cocktail, if we didn't ask for it we never would've gotten it. Don't like when you pay for a membership that you have to ask for your benefits. ( Unlike the Amex Platinum fine Hotels & Resorts) where they spell them all out for you at check -in. (Also By the way Crosby Street Hotel spells out your Tablet Plus Benefits for your at Check-in...loved that hotel!!) Sexy restaurant, Kittichai, nice apps and beautiful decor. Luckily we stayed here on a great rate. Couldn't go to Thom Bar because of private party---it happens, no biggie, we had martinis at kittichai. Music is pumping while you sleep at Thom Bar..Its definitely a fun hotel , but the service needs a shakeup.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE”
Reviews.Author: UnhappyJulie
Reviews.Content: This place is unbelievable. I Am in my room now, have been trying to sleep for 2 hours and cannot because of the bloody music (and i do have ear plugs on). I flew from hong kong to London this morning and from London to NYC this afternoon, so 20 hrs on plane and 13 hrs of jet lag... I called the front desk who said there is nothing they can do and passed me on to a "manager"... He basically said "tough luck, will go on till 2am and thats just the way it is" and added that he couldn't believe I could hear the music from the 4th floor (right, it just occurred to me to make up a story about non existing music...) and that the music was "very low at the mmt"... So given I can't sleep I thought I would check out the reviews, and here I am reading a bunch of comments about similar experiences from other people.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Jewel of a Boutique Hotel in Soho......”
Reviews.Author: moonrivermoon
Reviews.Content: The 60 Thompson Hotel doesn't take your breath away at all when you enter the lower lobby from the street as it's a rather stark, unwelcoming--or worse,--disappointing entrance and then one needs to go upstairs to check in where the reception desk is at the end of an attractive, relatively trendy room with very high ceilings and full length windows.......and, when we arrived, the lobby was quiet as we arrived on a Monday night, but from the moment we arrived (five fun women arriving for a celebration of a few us turning 50 from London and Connecticut), the staff was extremely friendly and incredibly accommodating. Two young doormen greeted us (Adrian and Mervin whose names I know because I told them when we departed that they were exceptional and I would put them, by name, in my review) and they couldn't do enough to get us settled with luggage and a car to be parked and a genuine smile to help us in any way. It honestly felt that they were not doing this because it was their job; they acted like they really wanted us to be happy with every aspect of our stay and they were delightful..... And our room was not large at all but it was quiet, very comfortable and had wonderful bedding. We were only there for two nights but by the time we left, we all honestly felt that the staff on every level was one of the most genuinely nice collection of people any of us had dealt with at a hotel in a long while......and some of us had been at top hotels in France and Switzerland before this trip. This hotel has a beautiful restaurant we did not eat in but it also has a fun, pretty bar in the lower level, a covered area to sit outside on the street to have a drink or, yes, a quiet cigarette, and we were able to walk to a myriad of the best spots in Soho in just minutes because of kind advice from the concierge or front desk. Great, memorable spot that had reasonable room rates, very quick room service that did not cost a million dollars to get a pot of coffee and a scrambled egg and, ultimately because it was a nice place to stay for our reunion. Accolades to whomever owns this hotel, or better yet, whomever manages this hotel, because he or she has clearly figured out how to instruct their staff to make a difference for visitors to the Soho area of NY that makes it all even more worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced and Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Buck M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year in September for 3 nights. Overall impression was not good and room was very small (which I know most would expect in this part of NY). The staff were not helpful or friendly at all. The bar on the roof top was not great or the bar in the bottom of the hotel. Overall I would strongly advise not to stay here unless you get a suit or you don't mind a tiny over priced room in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice close to NYU”
Reviews.Author: cameraman612
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 60 Thompson while visiting a daughter who is at NYU. There are a lot of great hotels in NYC, but not many in this part of town. 60T is just a few blocks from NYU, and in the middle of the artsy SOHO district. Things we liked about the hotel were location, friendly staff, quiet and well appointed room, and a reasonable price (for NYC anyway). Things we didn't were stuffiness in the room from a poorly functioning HVAC unit, spotty TV reception and the tiny exercise room. But bottom line is that we enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back as long as we have someone to visit in this part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: BigARM725
Reviews.Content: I booked on priceline which I had no control. I had stayed in the hotel several times in a suite on business and it was ok but they always remembered me. This time, probably because of priceline they had amnesia .... anyway they put me in a room directly above their night club / bar, it was so loud the glasses were vibrating on the dresser.. I called down joking in good mood expecting a quick move inviting the band up to my room,,,, the front desk obviously was instructed not to move me, (priceline?) and the manager was downright rude to me about the situation... the hotel was obviously low on occupancy, and the bellman (when I left) said he had "countless" similar situations... ??? !!!! wow,,,, never again for me, either business (when I found it tolerable, but way overpriced) nor risking getting it on priceline... I was shocked there was service so terrible in this day and age.... Aaron

Reviews.Title: “tasteful but dreary”
Reviews.Author: 10179k79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 60 Thompson every now and then since it opened twelve years ago. Back then it was happening and welcoming, today it is pretty dreary. All that is left is the still tasteful interior design, though now many of the furnishings are in shambles and in dire need of work. Textiles are worn and stained, handles are falling off of the furniture, the sink almost falls of off the wall upon touching it, faucets hang loose, the shower head has been replaced by a $4.99 variety in white plastic, and pretty much everything is chipped and seems to be falling apart. The staff matches this situation: No help with luggage upon arrival or cab hailing services, bored receptionist, people seem to have given up. Sad to see such a formerly great place going downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Average - not good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: Ing33
Reviews.Content: I was so looking to coming to this hotel as I had heard a lot about it and the great rooftop bar so when I had a 5 night work trip I was excited to choose here. But it was just really average and I'm so surprised. The rooms are OK, furniture a bit tired, the TV and room service is good.But no table or desk which I found really odd. I asked the girl at reception whether I could change to a room with a table as I was there for so long for work and would need to use my computer,she looked at me blankly and said the only ones with a desk were the suites and would I like to upgrade for several hundred ££ a night more. Um no thanks so therefore had to rest my computer on the luggage stand!! I can only assume that this hotel must not be targeting the business traveller - unlike Smyth, Tribeca Grand, Trump which I had previously stayed at. So it was winter and no rooftop bar, the lobby bar had thumping music every night and drunk squealing girls (ergh). Maybe as I'm in my late 30s I'm just being an oldie about this and you might like it if you were in your 20s. I just prefer more sophisticated and chilled out bars. I think maybe 60 Thompson relies too much on it's location and past reputation, but with great new hotels popping up all the time I do question whether this is enough nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MaureenM10549
Reviews.Content: I almost do not want to rave about this little find. A boutique hotel with a great location, excellent service and lots of nightlife choices! We'll be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaPiglet
Reviews.Content: From the Fatwitch Brownies left on your bed in the evening to the attentive staff, I can't say enough great things. The location is great. It was the perfect spot to spend 6 nights in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Cool spot in the heart of SOHO”
Reviews.Author: Chililover
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient and bags were delivered to the room promptly. We chose a King Deluxe room which was a good size although not huge. The room was tastefully appointed as was the bathroom which had an excellent shower and lovely Kiehls amenities. The bed was great, very comfortable. Concierge was very helpful and arranged some theatre tickets (Book of Mormon is hilarious but quite filthy!!) and restaurant reservations for us, Christmas lunch at Balthazar very good indeed!! The doormen were polite and helpful. The hotel is in a great location for shopping and restaurants, nearby is a good wine shop in Spring Street and also a laundry in Thompson street itsself if you need any clothes cleaned at a much better price than the fairly expensive hotel service. Excellent restaurants nearby include Balthazar, Osteria Morini and Peasant. Within the hotel Kittichai has excellent Thai food. Only slight issues were due to the age of the hotel, our bathroom door handle was nearly falling off and there was some wear and tear around one of the windows, no big drama though. Loved the area and the hotel and will be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “In the centre of cool shopping”
Reviews.Author: Eli_Asker
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights and had a wonderful stay. Clean room. Wonderful bed with lots of pillows. Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. They advised us on good restaurants for lunch and dinner, booked tables... I asked for a quiet room, and so it was. .Will definitely stay here next time we go to NYC.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithhubby
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd want a great hotel to be. Great service. Near some really great places to dine, too!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful on the room you go for!”
Reviews.Author: LisaD12326
Reviews.Content: A great hotel and a funky bar, fab location for a New York break however.... our first night was in a room above the bar which meant hearing the bass of the DJ until well into the early hours, not great when wanting to adjust for jet lag. I could have named the tunes it was so noisy. We asked to move rooms to a higher floor which solved it but be warned, their plumbing is really noisy especially if you are in one of the rooms in the back left corner. Big clunks (like air in pipes) everytime loo used anywhere in that vertical block it seemed. Funnily enough my neighbour has stayed there and said exactly the same thing. These are no the cheapest rooms either. Don't go for rooms ending in a 3 though the rooms are really great. We ended up treking with our bags to the end of the road as getting a taxi very early morning seemed beyond the door mans capability!

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home in the heart of Soho”
Reviews.Author: Paula H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our yearly holiday trip to NYC. This was our first visit to 60 Thompson and we were very impressed. What puts this hotel in front of all the others is the service - from the minute our car pulled up we were greeted warmly. Every staff member we encountered treated us with incredible kindness. Just a couple examples: Upon arriving to our room the housekeeper welcomed us and brought my 2 teenage daughters extra bath amenities (kiehls, their favorite) and Fat Witch brownies! One evening my daughter and I came home early from dinner (she was not feeling well) and the doorman offered to go to the pharmacy for us and the next day went out of his way to ask how she was doing! So, not only are you in the heart of Soho which is a dining and shopping dream - you also feel safe and very well cared for! This is our hotel of choice from here on out in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Diane D
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed here twice, in Sep '09 and May '11. Both times we felt really at home. It's clean and modern and feels hip, the rooms are comfortable, but its real star is the staff. The guys on the door were always extraordinarily welcoming, the desk and the room staff were friendly and efficient. We had breakfast and dinner at Kittichai and weren't that impressed, but this hotel's great location gives you tons of options for eating out.

Reviews.Title: “SLOW DEATH IN A MUSHROOM COLOURED MAUSOLEUM”
Reviews.Author: windyp
Reviews.Content: I loathed this hotel. Yes it's my personal opinion so let's break it down. The hotel is boring. Tedious. Boring. BUT maybe you like boring? Maybe boring suits you? Boring means no colour or brightness to assail your vision just different shades of mushroom. Boring means being able to get a cab within 60 seconds on leaving the building because nobody else is around at this grungy, shabby end of the delicious Thompson Street. Boring means being able to completely avoid the first floor lobby and its staff by taking the ground floor elevator straight up to your room. Boring means having no public areas to hang out in during the day except a very vacuous lobby area. Boring also means QUIET. If low key is your style book now. The whole place need a refurb. except perhaps the bar open evenings until 2pm. Ten years down the line I am SOO over dark brown corridors dimly lit. My bedroom was as dull and shabby as one could wish. TIRED furnishings, tables and cabinets. It had all that you need but I know you can do so much better for the price. I spent a lot of time in my room and was so tired of it after 6 nights I asked for a complimentary upgrade for my last weekend (duration of stay 9 days). The ineffectual manager showed me a room but refused the upgrade without my paying. Mean spirited. There is no service elevator. "What's the problem" I hear you ask. Well yes I agree but in fact it pissed me off grandly particularly in the mornings having to share the Elevator with racks of dry cleaning, bags of laundry, mops and buckets, a man with a hard floor polisher, room service debris and a chimney sweep. (No only kidding about the last one). Why build a new hotel (10 years old) without thinking of this? Oh well, I guess I'm just fussy. The restaurant downstairs is well known. Kittichai. It is an example of trend over successful cooking. Very dark and a nice place to meet an internet date, (I had one such couple sitting next to me). I was served a thai coconut soup in such a ridiculous paper 'bowl' I couldn't eat it for practical reasons. Once decanted into the bowl it should have been in to start with it tasted like a gloopy can of coconut milk with none of the freshness generally expected. One day the concierge just didn't bother to show up and I was fobbed off with excuses by the dreary lobby staff. I never used the concierge services after that. To end on a positive note the guys on the street door are delightful and will get you a cab in the flick of a lamb's tale. This sadly could not dissipate the dreadful sinking feeling I had on returning to this hotel each day. I felt as if I were entering a coffin. You can do better with your downtown hotel choice than this unless you are a celebrity with a penchant for mushroom colours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, service and stay”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Our stay over the Xmas weekend in this quiet but well appointed hotel in SoHo was great. Bellman even found us free parking on the street due to his extensive knowledge of holiday changes to NYC parking regulations! The room was good-sized and the bath was well appointed. Excellent restaurants within 2 blocks: Boquitera, Aquagrill and Snack.

Reviews.Title: “the heart of SoHo”
Reviews.Author: miguelstanley
Reviews.Content: i have stayed many times in SoHo and this Hotel is just what I needed. Not too expensive, great service, so well located but still private. Concierge pulls rabbits out of hats in terms of service. Great bar open till 2 am but no noise is carried.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Tribeca”
Reviews.Author: Mehmet I
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with plenty of restaurants and shopping facilities within just walking distance. Very friendly and helpful staff. Considerably spacious rooms with excellent decoration. Great roof bar, with the only set back being that hotel guests do not have a privileged access and you need to make reservations beforehand. We were not too happy to be refused entry on two occasions; it is not customary in Europe for an hotel guest to be turned away from any of the hotel's facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Perfect city experience”
Reviews.Author: citygirlatheart14
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. We reserved a Superior room, but was upgraded to a suite on a high floor! The room was super spacious complete with sitting area and TWO bathrooms! The location in Soho can't be beat. We shopped in Soho in the afternoon. Walked back to the hotel for a rest. Hung out in the hotel rooftop lounge until dinner, and walked to the village for dinner. The room was quiet and comfortable. We got up in the morning and walked over to Balthazar's for breakfast. A perfect city day for me. Service was good as well. Overall, very satisfied. I would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!! terrrible - Noisy, hot and dirty - had to be moved twice”
Reviews.Author: internationltravlr
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! I went with my parents over Thanksgiving. I had a room on the third floor and the room was incredibly noisy from the club downstairs. I was not told upon check-in even that the third floor is noisy though the staff told their boss that I was warned, which really annoyed me. When I called the front desk to ask to have the noise turned down, one of the staff said that they get complaints all the time and there is no soundproofing from the club downstairs which blasts music until 2am. His boss lied and said that they only occasionally get complaints - seems that lying is standard here. Then they moved me to another suite (as if that was a step up, when all I wanted to do was sleep). I went to get into the bed and the sheets were dirty with hairs all over - gross! I then had to get moved again. My parents stayed on the 11th floor and their room was crazy hot. They couldn't adjust the temperature and had to keep the window open at all times. It was super loud for them too. Needless to say we had terrible nights and will never be staying here again and I will do my best to tell everyone not to stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah C
Reviews.Content: I always stay here when in the city, and it's like home away from home most certainly. Everyone knows my name, who I am, and they all treat me like I'm a star. I'm very impressed by the staff, from the front desk to house keeping, the door man to the concierge, to the Bars managers.. I also LOVE the restaurant Kitti Chi, and the room service rocks here at 60 Thompson. The Penthouse suite is sweet to stay in, as well as the Thompson suites, some ate better than others, but I like the place over all. The basic rooms are great too. I love the 60 Thompson.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: mikecf1
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. I am in my room right now, it is after midnight, and the music from the club in the lobby is so loud that items in the room are literally VIBRATING. I spoke to the person at the desk and then the manager and they both told me that's how it always is and that the music goes until 2 AM. I was told that they do keep ear plugs on hand to help the guests deal with the music. He was serious. He then said that the music is usually even louder. So I am paying 500 dollars to sleep in a hotel that I can't sleep in. I wish I could record how loud this music is. I can't believe they aren't up front and honest about it. And my room is stifling hot without any AC. This place has ruined my trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Neil2507
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 60 Thompson from Sunday 6th Nov until Wed 9th Nov. I had just gotten off a 30 hour or so flight from Australia and so was feeling pretty tired. New York was fabulous but this hotel was an absolute shocker. The hotel was unbearably hot. I was in the top floor and suspect that made it much worse. When I turned on the cooling in my room hot air came out and made my room hotter. It was impossible to sleep unless you open the window. Unfortunately it was then impossible to sleep because of the street noise. Hence I had 3 sleepless nights following a 30 hour flight from Australia!! Upon telling the hotel staff the answer I repeatedly got was that due to the recent snow they were required to turn on the heating within the hotel and as the temperature got hotter instead of staying cold the rooms were hotter. But this is not good enough I am afraid. For the price of the rooms especially. On top of that rooftop bar was closed (as "too cold") and the bar at the reception level was under renovation. Restaurant for breakfast was beautiful but took over 1 hour for what I hoped was going to be a quick breakfast so that I could get out of the hotel. They said they were not expecting so many people that day (! There were only 6 table!), Overall I would recommend you give this hotel a big miss!

Reviews.Title: “my very last stay at the 60 Thompson”
Reviews.Author: franck078
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the 60, Thompson. I was mucky enough to stay in this hotel when it was very new, the staff still committed and enthusiastic. These days are gone: the staff looks utterly demotivated, does barely notice you, I was not given a hello when I arrived at reception for check in (I "had" to say hello). The person had me wait for 8 minutes, to come back and say that I had to be downgraded, as "my room was taken by a guest that had extended his stay". No apologies, no effort whatsoever. This hotel still benefits from a un-deserved glow of trendiness and quality. I strongly recommend not to go this hotel any longer.

Reviews.Title: “My home in NYC.”
Reviews.Author: JohnJRS
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to New York for work, and I have stayed at innumerable NY hotels, as I tend to be picky. 60 Thompson is home for me now and has been for some time. I love the location, the ambiance, the staff, and the rooms. I can't imagine staying elsewhere in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: strawberrysandwich
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel expecting a boutique hidden treasure, unfortunately shabby chic (shabby being operative word) is what we found. The hotel is nice, it's not dirty by by anyone's standards, but it's certainly not the luxurious hideaway that it's portrayed to be. A little tired, a little small, and the service does not do justice to the $600 per night price tag, oh and on top that internet is $15 for 24hrs....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / location”
Reviews.Author: 415Traveler415
Reviews.Content: I grew up in NY/NJ and know the city well. We decided to stop in NYC returning from an international trip to break up the flight getting back to San Francisco. The hotel was better than expected. The room was large for NYC standards, it was really nice and the service was friendly. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS OK”
Reviews.Author: traveltoparadise
Reviews.Content: For the first time in my life I arrived at a hotel and the room that we had reserved over a month before was not available. It was 1:00 am, we were tired, I had medical appointments the next morning and it was very unpleasant. But the hotel sent us to another hotel for the first night and asked us to come again the next day. They paid for this night at this other hotel. When we came back the next day, they upgraded our room, and did not charge us the first night because of the inconvenience we experienced. The manager wanted to meet me, but I did not find the time. Being fair, the hotel is very pretty, the restaurant in the first floor is very good and we also liked the bar. Many restaurants near by that are very good like Boqueria.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Soho w/ Rooftop Lounge”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodBeachFun
Reviews.Content: The outside of this hotel has you feeling like your pulling up to your residence with the doorman awaiting your return. It’s a tall slim building. It’s located right next to one of Soho’s best Thai Restaurants Kitticha (?) It was my second time dining there and I recommend the Red Curry Sea Bass w/ side of vegetables. Checking into the hotel the staff was extremely friendly & informative. It was a Sunday so the hotel was a bit quiet. Plenty of seating in the window lined lobby that boast a brown and cream interior, very earthy. There is a restaurant off the lobby. After riding the elevator up to room 44, I was admiring the wood surrounding the hallways and the corridors leading to the few rooms that occupy each floor. This was one of the smaller rooms I stayed in but, the décor & comfortable luxury made up for that. No view but a spacious beautiful bathroom you want to spend more time in. The shower was very cool. Around 5pm the rooftop bar opens, a great place to come after you dined a Kittichai for a cocktail over looking the Empire State Building. The vast view with very little building makes you feel like you stepped outside the city; very pleasant. The décor is carried all the way upstairs and is elegant, sophisticated with a woodsy feel. I loved this space. Warning… if you plan on catching a cab to the airport arter 4pm “Forget-a-bout-it”, I waited 40 minutes for a cab, then decided it was too late to catch my flight. Now the bellman stood out in the rain that long trying to hail a cab. A few car services came by but they will charge you between $75 and up when the far is only $45. The hotel offers a car service for $115 that includes all tolls & tips if you can afford that. I love the location of this hotel, it was 4 walking blocks to Trump Soho & it’s also right around the corner from my new favorite pizza place: “Bens”. You must get a slice here, perfection. There are so many shops to visit in this trendy, artsy area. I will definitely go back to this hotel. For you “Foursquare “ users, be sure to check in and show them you did. They offer a free room upgrade if you do. I paid about $175. (w/tax $240.). I booked this hotel from a company called Magellen Vacations. Because of this, I got a free room upgrade and or complimentary breakfast. I suggest calling them first because they always beat the hotels prices by at least $10-25. Plus they don’t charge a fee since the hotels give them referral fees. You have to call them because they don’t post prices on their website, it’s how they can keep the prices down. You will call them first on all your vacations, I do. They booked two hotels for me and when there is a problem with the bill, they take care of it right away for you.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: winelover010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with a girlfriend. Overall it was very good. The room was very good and quite spacious. The bedding and the bathroom amenities were excellent. We had a complimentary cheese tray upon arriving as well as one on the night we left, (a nice touch). The rooftop bar was very cool and the staff up there were very attentive. We didn't eat at the hotel because there are so many cool restaurants and bars that are so close. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the chains....”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: Sometimes hotels that try and be trendy end up being too focused on being funky and trendy, and forget that at the end of the day people are looking for quiet, comfortable rooms, and great service. Having stayed at some, I feared that Sixty Thompson in Soho New York would be one of the former - as they make much of their style, attitude and locations in trendy parts of town. I had also read mixed reviews, including those talking about the place being a bit shabby. Overall, I was impressed with the hotel. I found the location was great (right within easy access of all that Soho has to offer) but in a quiet spot. I found the decor stylish, without being overly done. The staff almost without exception were friendly, genuine and chatty. The hotel is not cheap, but not many are in New York. I had asked for a room higher up as heard that the lower rooms can suffer from noise from the trendy bar on the lobby floor. And it was quiet and peaceful. The room was a decent size, with decent sized bed (though not as comfy as some of the chain hotels), sofa, big TV. But no desk to be able to sit and work at. This was a miss as sure these days even people not on work also like to sit on a laptop and so on. The wireless access is expensive at $14.75, and it costs per device and so if you attaching a work laptop and maybe a personal iPad you pay twice. The bathroom was great, and had shower and no bath. Something more common these days. Room service was very fast and very friendly. The restaurant downstairs, which is a Thai fusion, was not that good in my view. It is very popular and although I was so-so on the food, they did amazing cocktails (especially the Classic Moijto) There is a very small fitness room in the basement that was average. But enough stuff to have a decent workout. The hotel was good at checking and watching activity on twitter @60_thompson and noted comments and so on through my stay. This was a nice touch too. Overall a pleasant place to stay. Good alternative to chains...

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home - great for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: SpanishDreamer14
Reviews.Content: The location of the 60 Thompson in Soho close to Tribeca, is brilliant. It is in the heart of some great shopping, great restaurants and close to some of the popular New York sights including Little Italy, China Town, Washington Square Park to name but a few. Walking uptown towards Times Square is a pleasure as well as walking downtown towards the South Island ferry port. Our room (upgraded for free to a suite) was spacious, immaculate, comfortable and ideal. Special touches from the general manager Saye included a bottle of Champagne, a drinks invite upon arrival, chocolate coated strawberries in the room and complimenntary mineral water daily. Every detail is attended too in this modern and chic hotel. The New York times is delivered daily and the concierge or front desk are happy to help with restaurant bookings, taxis and any other requirement you may have. My only gripe would be the restaurant located on the ground floor, which I am sure is independant of the hotel. The prices are extortionate, the service slow and the staff generally sour faced. Would I come back to the 60 Thompson - absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: ashleyw
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after going back and forth between the Trump Soho. It was our 9th wedding anniversary so we wanted it to be special. Booked through Perfect escapes which entails: (first two based on avail.) 1.early check in 2.room upgrade 3. welcome amenity (also mentioned through the booking that it was an anniversary) 1. not available 2. not available (even though i could go on-line and book the higher room category 3. had to call down 3 hours after check in and ask for the welcome amenity, arrived without even a "happy anniversary" We stayed in a Deluxe King and the room was in desperate need of a makeover, did not feel "cool, hip, or luxurious". Noise was not an issue- we asked for a higher floor. I was told by the front desk that rooms close to the bar were usually given to people staying one night and since we were there for 3, no worries, so Beware! SPoke with 2 different concierges on 2 occasions, not very helpful. I usually stay at SOHO grand when in Soho, and it is a much better hotel. I wish that I chose the Trump, I know that they would have gone the extra mile. I have 2 rooms booked at the Thompson in Toronto for NYE and am seriously reconsidering based on my stay here. The hotel was clean, room service was prompt, the location is great. this is the only reason i am giving this place 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Room was just OK. Check your hotel bill.”
Reviews.Author: tstarponce
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this hotel. Location was great, it was wonderful exploring the neighborhood, and lots of food options around. The rooftop bar is amazing, great cocktails and gorgeous view, should be offering food options in the next month or so. The Thai restaurant downstairs, Kittichai, is pretty cool, great decor and delicious spicy food. My colleague ate breakfast downstairs and said it was very good. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Doorman ran down the street to grab me a cab when I was running late. Only cons were my hotel room was small, but expected. However, I thought it needed an update. Also was charged extra for mini-bar items that I never purchased. I might stay here for the location, but may consider a more up to date hotel for the decor and definitely check the hotel bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff.. Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Hoyas27
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for a couple nights at 60 Thompson and was very pleased with the service I received. When checking-in, there was a mix-up where I was booked for a smaller room than I had reserved. Despite the confusion, the staff was very accomodating and helpful as they upgraded my room. The stay was great overall. I will definitely return to 60 Thompson when doing business in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently the best hotel in New York! Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: LMorganToronto
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York for work a lot (and for fun) and have tried staying in many hotels over the years but keep coming back to 60 Thompson. I refer to it as my home away from home. The location is amazing (right in the heart of Soho), the hotel itself is excellent but what differentiates it for me is the amazing staff. They are so friendly, helpful and professional. I am fairly demanding and I have always been so impressed with the lengths that they go to for me. Also - in the summer they have one of the best rooftops in the city - not to be missed! They make the best cocktails in NYC! Happy at 60Thompson

Reviews.Title: “My perfect experience at 60 Thompson”
Reviews.Author: chu014
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently celebrated our engagement in New York City. There were so many hotels to choice from in NYC. After looking at a number of pictures and researching locations of hotels- we decided to book a room at 60 Thompson. When we arrived, we were immediately greated by staff who treated us like royalty. The entire staff was very courteous and professional. The room was amazing! It was pleasantly clean and modern with all the little details that made us feel like V.I.P We ordered a bottle of Champagne and a chocolate cake to celebrate. The ambience was breathtaking. The location of the hotel was in walking distance of many restaurants, stores and other attractions. Our stay was perfect, and I would not book at any other place but 60 Thompson next time we visit NYC. Thank you for making our memorable weekend a sucess!

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: kolib
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to be directed towards this hotel by a friend. Being from Atlanta, I do nto often get to spend time (whether business or leisure) in NY. I was not sure where to stay, realizing, that in NY, a lot of hotel are over price but underclass...Well I can say that 60 Thompson is proper price and very classy. -The rooms are clean, stylish, upscale, but yet simple enough where you arent calling the front desk every 5 seconds to help find something. -The location wwas perfect, and allowd my colleagues and I to actually walk to our meeting (with some guides from the hotel staff), which was a nice experience. The location also allowed us to see some of the sights in NY. - The service was exceptional, from the hotel manager personally handling our desires, to the bell hop going the extra mile however he could. For the location and quality of the hotel, the value is extremely reasonable. - This may sound cliche, btu honestly, i slept like a baby, which is hard for me to do outside of my own bed. OVERALL: I would recommend this hotel to anyone, whether business or leisure. In fact my family and I are going to be returning there in August.

Reviews.Title: “60 Thompson Chic, Comfortable and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JHFandLSB
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a weekend away with colleagues. What a great find the 60 is. If you are coming to NYC to hang out in a very cool and trendy location then you will love the sixty, The concierge team couldn't do enough to help us with our stay, I spoke to them via email for a few weeks prior to arrival and they recommended restaurants, clubs car service nothing was too much trouble. On arrival we only had to wait a very short time for our rooms which were worth the wait. Don't expect a quiet hotel bar on a Saturday night but if you want to be in a bar with great music open late and just a short lift to your room then you will love this. NYC needs to be experienced and the 60 Thompson seems very New York...it's a great hotel and I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - I cut short my stay and moved to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: br0c0lli
Reviews.Content: Made a big mistake staying here - was traveling on work and realised soon that the hotel isnt equipped for the business traveller - (there's no desk in the room, for e.g.) and the internet is painfully slow. But even otherwise the service was awful - everyone seemed to be doing me a favour. And my room was like a sauna. When I asked about air-conditioning, i was asked to open my window. Was happy to cut my stay short and move to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jga831
Reviews.Content: The DJ at the nightclub goes until 2:30 a.m. He is loud with a resounding bass and you will not miss a note in your room. It's hard to sleep anyway as the room is very hot due to central heating so you must alternate between the room to cold with the window open and too hot with it closed. Calls to the front desk elicit mumbled apologies and no action. On the upside the toiletries are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Great Place to Stay in SoHo”
Reviews.Author: rickydow1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the 60 Thompson several times over the last year and each time they more than met my expectations. The staff greets me every time I arrive with a "Hello, Mr. Dow...welcome back!", before I even have to tell them who I am. The hotel is always very clean, the staff always very friendly, and the service always top-notch. It's a great place for me to unwind after long work days at the office. I wanted to mention one experience I had with the hotel that truly set them apart. It was St. Patrick's Day 2010. I had gotten to town a bit late and missed my chance to drop my bags and check in before heading out to a client dinner. After several drinks with our clients, I finally showed up to the hotel to check in around 11 p.m. When I arrived, they told me that they didn't have my room any longer, but had booked me a suite at the Bowery Hotel (another great joint) up the road and would be comping my stay both that night and the following back at 60 Thompson. Needless to say, I was floored, because frankly, it was my fault for not advising the hotel of my late arrival. Upon my return the following day to 60 Thompson, I was greeted by the manager, offered the Thompson Suite for my troubles. As if this wasn't enough, when I got to my room, I found a bottle of champagne and a hand-written note from the general manager apologizing for my troubles. (Yeah, some trouble!) To show my thanks for their incredible service, I sent a note to the head of the hotel's customer service department, and copied the owner of the hotel, Jason Pomeranc. Within two hours, I'd heard back personally from both of them, expressing their gratitude for my loyalty and offering apology for the trouble. Because of this level of service (and a pretty nice property, as well), I will never stay at another hotel in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “sohos best”
Reviews.Author: tcs98
Reviews.Content: this is a superb hotel in soho,great beds,clean,awesome staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel ever! Front desk has ear plugs, so you know you are in for trouble.”
Reviews.Author: MaxnBaci
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a very good location, I have never stayed in a noisier room in my entire life. There is a Salsa club on the 2nd floor with live music until 2am,and the rooms are on 3-11. Our room was on 4 and the walls were shaking from the base. Front desk told us there was another room on 6, but nothing higher. We tried the room on 6, but you could still hear the base through the walls. We ended up leaving the hotel at 1am and were not charged. I would not stay in this hotel below the 11th floor. Also, the have flat panel LG TV's that do not have HD pictures. Unless you like Salsa music at 2am on Sunday night I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience- unimpressive rooms and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: temh
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the third floor but we were not told that we be directly above a very loud bar with a DJ that played until 2 AM. I had ear plugs sent up but the music was so loud that I was still not able to sleep. The music was so loud that I could hear the lyrics of the songs! The hotel staff did not mention at check-in that they were putting us in a room with noise issues. If they had I would have requested a room on a different floor because we were exhausted after our red-eye flight from San Francisco. The room itself was very basic and poorly designed-- not what I would have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect week-end - relaxed but stylish”
Reviews.Author: SG2ANY
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite holiday traditions is our week-end in NYC just before Christmas. We've stayed all over Manhattan, but particularly love staying in Soho because there is great shopping plus a whole lot more and it's away from the craziness of Mid-town. From the moment we arrived EVERYONE we came in contact with at the hotel was friendly and helpful. We immediately relaxed and enjoyed every minute of our time there. I saw come comments about noise level, but I didn't find this to be the case at all. Love the restaurant and lounge. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay -- love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boders
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC quite a bit and always try to stay at a different hotel each time I go as I think hotels in NYC are very unique and each has something different to offer. With that said, my last experience at another hotel in SoHo was so bad I decided to return to 60 Thompson as I was very impressed the first time I stayed there, and likewise this time around. Very nice staff, decent size rooms for NYC, Kiehl bath products (love!), gorgeous marble bathroom, etc. And I have had my share of fun in the bar off the lobby! I will for sure be back yet again!

Reviews.Title: “The bargain of the century”
Reviews.Author: Wahaay
Reviews.Content: The regular quoted priced for this hotel was $529 per night but due to a computer glitch we found one night advertised online for $52 ( what an expensive missing nine that was ) and booked immediately. To their credit the hotel honoured the booking and my wife and I had an excellent ( but short ! ) stay at this hotel. It's everything you'd expect of a designer boutique hotel with a great Thai restaurant on the ground floor. a hip bar where we got nicely pickled and ultra-cool staff dressed in black. As I'd never pay $529 for a night in a hotel ( and during fashion week this went up to $600 ) it's hard to say whether what was on offer represented good value. But we slept well, had a great power shower and found the staff friendly and efficient without being haughty. We left with a skip in our steps and a wry smile from the front desk. What a result. Customer 1 Expensive Hotel 0

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LAEventPlanner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a business trip. The bellman, concierge and housekeeping staff were very good. The front desk has an attitude (but don't they always)? I was given an upgrade because of my position. I loved my corner King room -- Great views and spacious. I saw one of the Queen rooms and it looked like a coffin. Luckily, I didn't have to spend 5 nights in one of those rooms. I was forced to call the front desk everytime I wanted to call roomservice, the bellman, housekeeping. They don't have an operator on staff or give out extensions to other department which doesn't make sense to me. The front desk is busy and doesn't have the time or patience to be a PBX operator. Other than that, it's a great hotel for the value and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good find. We'd return.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel02
Reviews.Content: Low key contemporary small hotel in very handy SoHo location. Easy to walk to much of what we wanted to do. Service friendly and excellent at all times. Kittichai is an excellent restaurant. We didn't use the 3rd floor bar, as didn't like it. The rooftop bar wasn't operating during our visit as the weather was cool, but looked a good spot. Our 12th floor room faced east and was above nearby rooflines, and thus had lovely morning sun. We stayed a week, and enjoyed the simplicity and "no fuss" approach here. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: bethschax
Reviews.Content: 60 Thompson has a great location but the rooms are just sort of an afterthought. They are nice, well laid out, but the cable tv doesn't work, the internet costs $10 in a suite and there are no hair dryers in the room. The showers are plumbed really poorly so that you can't really get a hot shower that hits you, you have to duck under it. When I arrived the restaurant was closed for a private party, so was the rooftop bar and the lounge had a Cuban band so the chance of getting a nice nightcap was zero. There are no ice machines, but an ice bucket. That sort of thing. Where you can tell the hotel staff wants to provide great service but the company really is maximizing profits to the point where guests are the lowest priority. It's a great location but as a luxury hotel I feel like they are missing that last 20%.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel/location, and management did the right thing with respect to our one complaint.”
Reviews.Author: phoebecaulfield73
Reviews.Content: I went with a small group of girlfriends for birthday/night away from kids, and the hotel was perfect for this. Unfortunately, one room was extremely noisy and made sleep (a stated goal for the trip!) somewhat difficult to say the least. After some reasonable discussion, that particular room was comped. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “quietly sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: 60 Thompson is in a great location if you're looking for the buzz of Soho and the lobby bar is a great place for a pre-dinner cocktail - very smooth. The decor is understated, at least in comparison with some of the other New York hotels, it feels more 'business' than 'cool and fun'. Still, 60 Thompson scores a 'Pink' in the neilsonparc Lust List. I was disappointed that the rooftop bar was closed - ok it was December when I stayed, but other hotels still had operational rooftop bars at the same time....

Reviews.Title: “I slept 10 hours . . . isn't that what it's all about?”
Reviews.Author: PigsFly
Reviews.Content: Great restful trip. It offers a very soothing atmosphere without overdoing the whole Zen-Asia-Minimalist thing. Staff very accommodating, no snobbery. Everyone very helpful. This is a nicely designed hotel that offers a great rest -- check in and catch up on your sleep. There's a garden upstairs on top, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic roof top bar. ok room.”
Reviews.Author: lisa1424
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights. Location is perfect for shopping or exploring soho. Room was small but nice, and totally fine. Bath room spacious and with Kiehl´s amenities. I loved the roof top bar, breakfast was also very good. The Thai restaurant seems overrated, but is definitely a stylish hang-out. Would stay again, in fact already made next reservation. Oh, one more thing: Fitness room is not great. Small, dark, no window.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY.NOISY.NOISY”
Reviews.Author: TurtleFrenchie
Reviews.Content: If you decide to stay here, whatever you do make sure you are not put on the 3rd floor - it is directly above the bar. I stayed 3 nights and on each of them was kept awake till the wee hours by the (really, really crap) music blaring into my room. Other than that it was fine (if you like paying $330 a night for a small room with a brick wall for a view)

Reviews.Title: “It's SoHo”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED: Dead in the middle of SoHO, restaurants and things to do are just feet away. Located on a quiet street. This is clearly an expensive choice, figure at least $400 a night. Rooms are small, quite small and I noted a bit of wear and tear. Bathrooms were beautiful and a sight to see. Staff was present and efficient, not unfriendly, their mission is to serve you and stay out of the way. The roof top deck is a MUST SEE and the lower level restaurant is a fine choice. The subway is less than a block away. There is no desk area in the room so don't plan on trying to work from here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: foodmanToronto
Reviews.Content: Once they moved us, we loved our suite. We had a great view of the west side of the City. We had a cute little balcony. Our suite was perfect. We love nyc, so we loved staying at Thompson... We will definitely come back...

Reviews.Title: “As Expected”
Reviews.Author: eatsaroundtown
Reviews.Content: 60 Thompson is a great place to stay if you are looking for a small chic hotel in New York that is close to shopping. Rooms were on the small side but that is to be expected. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and overall we had a good experience. I can't say that we would book our next New York room at the 60 Thompsonbut it is definately on our list of hotels that we could return to.

Reviews.Title: “cool place to hang out, nice location but rooms are smaller than at Thompson LES”
Reviews.Author: LadyBug201005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Thompson LES last time and the decor and the size of the rooms are much better in terms of value at LES. We are a big fan of this chain and had a great time at both of those hotels. 60 Thompson has better location in terms of luxury shoppings, thai restaurant was amazing. Neveretheless, even thought the weather was great, the roof top was closed until May 15. We stayed at 4th floor and heard a music that was coming down from the lobby of the hotel. The music and the crowd was actually nice, but when it is time to sleep one just wants quite room. The walls are not soundproof, there was a lots of toilets being flushed and people talking in next rooms. Overall, the hotel is trendy, the service is great, just wish their rooms were bigger. We paid over $400 per night for a basic queen size room

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for trendy Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: lux_chick
Reviews.Content: Our King Deluxe room was quite disappointing. Although the comfort of bed and pillows etc was exceptional, the bathroom was in dire need of an update. The shower was very below average and did not work properly which added to the fact that we only had hot water from the basin. My husband who desires baths (which is why we booked a room with a bath and not just shower) had to use the hand held shower to fill bath with hot water. Bathroom products were rather sparse - no shower caps, no shower/bath gel, no toilet rolls - all of which we had to phone for. Room service was great as was the restaurant. However, the main reason for booking this hotel apart from its location was for the roof terrace. It was baking hot during the week we were there (record highs) but the roof terrace was not open which made our stay a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Area, Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: notsofrosty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on a leisure trip. The hotel is in a great location. We felt quite safe at night and were in short walking distance from many shops and restaurants. The hotel itself is definitely showing its age though. It's not quite as hip & trendy as it once was. The room carpet was dingy and gray from dirt and wear. My first thought upon entering was, "This place could use a fresh coat of paint and new carpet. I think I'll keep my shoes on". The bathroom was nicely decorated though with black marble and Kiehl's toiletries. Housekeeping was prompt and detailed (aside from missing an empty cocaine(?) vial, left from the previous guests..Whoops! Welcome to NYC!). Delicious Fat Witch brownies were on the pillows at turndown. We had excellent service. The concierge, front desk & doormen, while young, were more than helpful and always met us with a smile. There are many complaints regarding the loud club music. We were high enough not to hear it from our room, but one night we stopped by the front desk and it was definitely very loud and pulsating. Definitely get a room on a higher floor. I'd recommend this hotel as a acceptable place to stay, but don't expect the cutting edge 60 Thompson it once was.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, but noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: 7Cycle
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend recently at 60 Thompson. Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and location. However, the hotel has one of the busiest bars in lower Manhattan. We were on the third floor. The very loud bar scene and live music kept us up on both Saturday and Sunday nights. We complained, and, the manager gave us a token credit. However, the staff clearly know which rooms are noisy, so I expect they deal with this issue each weekend. I would recommend the hotel, but be warned - ask for a room as far away from the bar as possible.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD CHEESY MUSIC ALL NIGHT LONG!”
Reviews.Author: jenny241
Reviews.Content: Was put in a room on the third floor. Came home at ten pm to throbbing, pulsating cheesy music coming into our room. Called the front desk -- was informed that this music is from 60 Thompson's bar, that the music would continue until four in the morning, that people complain about it every night, and there was nothing that they could do. They wouldn't move us to another room. They wouldn't give us a noise machine. It was a nightmare. So bad that we checked out and moved to another hotel that night. Don't stay here. Trust me. You will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: LadybirdinLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at 60 Thompson after receiving a pretty good deal on Quikbook... The location is absolutely great if you want to be downtown.. perfect for shopping, eating out etc. The room we were given happened to be directly above the hotel bar and we were kept awake the first night by the thump of the bass from downstairs. Fortunately we were moved the following day to a much nicer (and larger) room a few levels up. The staff were pretty friendly but it is one of those places thats is a bit 'too cool for school!' we walked in on a magazine shoot in the lobby one day. I think this hotel is fine if you can get a decent priced room.. but with so many 'designer' hotels in this area, I would definitely shop around for the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CERAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We found this was a wonderfull hotel. Spacious rooms (i did have a deluxe) with a nice modern, yet warm setting. The staff was very friendly, so the bad reviews on the staff really surprised me. Soho is just a great area to stay, especially if you've stayed in midtown before and want to enjoy 'the other part of new york'. get yourself a good deal and start enjoying this hotel! And get to the restaurant! Enjoy the tuna starter: jummie!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler8
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here at the last minute for a little birthday weekend fun. The room was clean and a great size. I also loved the view out our window. The woman who checked us in was polite and helpful. We never made it into the bar because there was a private party going on, but we enjoyed our drinks in the lounge area and felt well taken care of. I love the neighborhood and the easy access to the subway. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust them!”
Reviews.Author: Fryzer
Reviews.Content: Being part of a large party who had booked several months in advance at a"special rate", we were staggered to find that the hotel had cancelled the booking totally and had not bothered to notify the organising party. They apparently had found they could make a much bigger markup with new guests! What would have happened if we had all turned up for the "occasion" is mind boggling. Another equivelant hotel has been found and I am sure all will be fine, but even though we would have had a good argumen , I for one am glad to be staying elsewhere because who knows what other slippery tricks 60 Thompson had up their dirty sleeves?

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting service!”
Reviews.Author: londongal20
Reviews.Content: I am bridesmaid at a wedding in NY in April and the whole wedding party was due to stay at 60 thompson (we are talking at least 50-60 people). The bride negotiated a slight discount because of the bulk booking a year ago, at the height over the recession. This week she found out that because the hotel is now doing better and they can get more for the rooms, the discount no longer applies. So now, on top of organising the wedding, she has to find rooms for all the guests in NY in 2 months time. Stressful, to say the least, and really short-sighted of 60 thompson. I work in fashion and travel extensively to NY and am telling EVERYONE i know and work with about what they did. I will never set foot in that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rough around the edges, but give it a shot”
Reviews.Author: netwerqq
Reviews.Content: Pros: *Excellent location *Friendly service *Nice boutique modern design Cons: *Heaven help you if you get a room above the bar, like I did (thumping house music all night) *Room was a little worn and needed some refreshening (bathroom door didn't close completely That said, I think the problems might have been specific to that room and I'd give it one more try due to the excellent location and reasonable rates for a hotel of that caliber.

Reviews.Title: “bring earplugs...”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at 60 Thompson. I wasn't blown away the first time 4 years ago, but decided to give it another chance as prices were at a record low. Sadly, I was quite dissapointed again. One of biggest issues I have with the hotel is the noise. The room doors have huge gaps underneath, so whether its doors banging or people talking in the hallway, you'll be sure to hear. On one day we were entertained by an argument between a guest and a hotel employee, where the guest complained of someone breaking into their room. surely not something other guests should be listening to. Another lovely noise came from the plumbing, everytime someone flushed a toilet above or next to our room, we could hear it behind our headboard. In the morning, we were waken up by the construction site across the street. We had a King Deluxe room, which I assumed would be decent in size as there were two smaller options, and supposedly it had a "separate living area". Well, the so called living area was a couch tucked at the end of the room, with about 5 feet of space to the bed, and no coffee table. we hadded to use one of the night stands as a computer table. which brings me to the internet connection, at times not functioning at all and otherwise just unacceptably slow, as another reviewer already pointed out. Service left very mixed feelings, there was a very snotty fellow working at the front desk when I called there a couple of times, he actually hung up on me once even though I wasn't finished with what I was saying. a couple of female employees on the other hand were quite helpful. Breakfast at Kittichai was alternating, on one morning everything went well but on another the food was mediocre and service extremely slow despite hardly any customers besides us. Overall, this hotel lacks on many levels. its not the hip boutique hotel it seemingly tries to be, but an overpriced, slightly washed out one. With the usual prices taken into consideration, I wouldn't even pay half of them to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great location and cosy room”
Reviews.Author: patricesantiago
Reviews.Content: 1 week stay at thompson, location is a must if you dont want to be in upper manhattan. Plenty of things to do at walking distance, shopping and nightlife, and a few metro stations to museums. Room very cosy and warm, not small by nyc standards. Room very quiet, not the street noise you get in up manhattan, however, not really a family hotel, and guests usually party quite late.Overall,very nice hotel atmosphere, and staff usually very nice, although i agree with previous comments, there can be some exeptions, and can be quite snobish.If you can get a good rate, strongly recommend thompsom 60.

Reviews.Title: “beware of construction sites!”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel wasn't great as we were greeted by a rather rude and blunt male employee at check in. He did nothing more than compulsory tasks with a blank face, and didn't do anything to make us welcome. our room was decent but not very fresh looking, rather outdated. we were woken up on a monday morning to the sounds of a construction site right outside our window, right after 8AM. this meant loud banging, drilling, yelling and cars/trucks driving down the street probably much more then usual. the windows were clearly very thin and also let in lots of cold air. being quite jetlagged and tired after travelling, the noise was obviously very irritating. the hotel could be nice, but falls short of expectations. the price level isn't justified.

Reviews.Title: “not half bad”
Reviews.Author: bagladyofbirstall
Reviews.Content: everything about this hotel screamed luxury,the staff were exceptional especially the door staff.we had room service which was the only downside,it was ok! for the price that we paid which was £100 per nite it was well worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,comfy rooms,helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: alwayswandering002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a week in NY staying at 60 Thompson.While a lot of the staff may have been chosen on their looks never the less we found them helpful and accommodating.In particular the concierges were always willing to help with bookings and advice.The restaurant on site,"Kittichai" is beautifully set up,with good service and excellent food.Our room on the 7th floor was reasonably sized, comfortable and quiet.Being removed from the hustle and bustle of uptown and in the midst of the quirky appeal of Soho is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room!”
Reviews.Author: kellyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel to stay at for amazing location. Steps to Central Park, Radio City, Columbus Square, and very close to Times Square, this hotel was an ideal location for a visit to NYC. The room was small, very small - and we had upgraded to a queen. There was no closet, only an armoire, and therefore we had to call up to request an iron and ironing board. That being said, the bathroom was quite lovely and spacious. But really, in NYC, room size doesn't matter...because you should not be in your room except to sleep! Go out and DO something! The people working here were lovely, and the hotel was very very clean. The hallways were a bit dark, but serviceable. We took advantage of the free luggage storage before our trip back home. WiFi was $10 USD per 24 h.

Reviews.Title: “60 Thompson is not a Boutique Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Josephine B
Reviews.Content: I was there for 3 nights to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. After a 7 hour drive we were at the front desk at 2:30 and check-in at 3:00, not a room avalaible.Very cold welcome by the receptionist that we seemed to bother. We had a king size room but don't bother to pay more since all the rooms are the same (very small) and the only difference is the size of the bed. Very noisy hotel where everytime a guest closes a door it makes a terrible noise. You can also hear everyone in the hallway. I'm a member of Small Luxury Hotels (SLH) and I travelled everywhere in boutique hotels. 60 Thompson IS NOT a boutique hotel. For example, even though I wrote to the management few weeks before our arrival telling them about the special occasion, nothing was made to highlight the fact. Is it too much to ask to have a small note in the room ? There is a very nice roof terrace but it's only open from 5:30pm. It would be great to enjoy the quietness of the place, the view, a drink at anytime of the day. If you need to use a computer, you'll have to use the small one on the front desk, standing in the middle of everyone. The only goog things are the friendly welcome from the doormen and the location. I wouldn't pay more than 200$ for this hotel. It was 400$ + 55$ for parking. Ridiculous...

Reviews.Title: “This botique didn't have the charm I was looking for”
Reviews.Author: DinoTheDiver
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here in early October. Was disappointed - room was small (though typical of an NYC hotel room), amenities were limited, bed was just OK. Teh worst part, however, was how noisy the hotel was: the bar at reception was cranking music until 3am on a Wednesday night... The toilet flush was like the Hoover Dam unloading... And worst of all, teh bottom of my door wasn't very well sealed off, so hallway noise (and - yuk - secondhand smoke!) intruded all night. I slept from 3am until 6. I figure it was $150 an hour. Not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “60 Thompson is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: atljs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 60 Thompson in September 2009. Everything about it was fantastic -- the location, the rooms, the staff, etc. The design of the room is beautiful, and it was a good size, especially for a NYC hotel room. You can't beat the location, since it's in SoHo. You can easily walk to plenty of restaurants, shops, etc. My room overlooked the street, but it wasn't loud at all (at least for me). I'd definitely recommend 60 Thompson!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: flyingfrenchman007
Reviews.Content: Nice little boutique hotel in the heart of SOHO. Nice bars, great staff and very knowledgable about everything you need from shopping to restaurants. Great area to stay for a romantic weekend away from the tourist frenzy of Midtown. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Winter Escape”
Reviews.Author: discovery2106
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 60 Thompson in Dec 08 for a pre-Christmas escape to New York. Everything about the hotel was fabulous! We flew in early morning and the reception kept track of our room and phoned us as soon as it was available even though is was only 10.30am. The room was well equipped, clean and very comfortable. The concierge really knew their stuff and were always only to happy to help out. The hotel isn't only in a great location but it is surrounded by cafes that serve fantastic coffee, tempting boutiques all with a great village feel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good overall”
Reviews.Author: RusNewton
Reviews.Content: I don't have a good track record of picking hotels in New York and so when this one was recommended to me by a colleague I thought I might as well give it a shot. Overall, I was not disappointed. Arrival impression was not great because at street level is the restaurant; reception is upstairs and I was not offered assistance with my luggage. Furthermore, both receptionists were on the phone when I arrived and so I waited longer than I would like to check in - which after 8 hours travelling is not welcome. Room itself was clean and looked fairly recently updated, bed comfortable, decent bathroom. As with most NYC hotels, pretty small though. I didn't have any noise issues (another common problem in NY). Breakfast quite nice. Wall Street is about a 25min walk away. Certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cecir
Reviews.Content: Luxury Hotels website sold us the idea that although the Hotel was away from other bar scenes, this hotel has two very popular cool bars to enjoy. When I checked in I was excited and could not wait to try their roof top and inside bar. On our first night we were very disappointed to learn that both bars were closed for PRIVATE EVENT so we decided to go somewhere else. On our second night we wanted to have a drink in the afternoon before getting ready for dinner and again the bars were closed til 9 pm. Well they lied after having dinner and looking forward to coming back to our hotel to enjoy the facilities, the inside bar was supposed to be closed for a PRIVATE EVENT until 12:30. We waited in the lobby until 1:30 am and they would not allow us in. I found it very insulting to be paying top dollar for a hotel whose premises are closed for other events. One of their employees told us that they frequently rent the bars to a local company that books events for them. In conclusion, the hotel was very nice but if the only available part of the hotel is my room, I rather go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ianp1
Reviews.Content: I had actually stayed at 60 Thompson's sister hotel, 6 Columbus, in January... which proved so gloomy with such bad lighting that you almost needed a white stick to manoeuvre about your room. 60 Thompson is quite different... and a much better experience. I had a light-filled room on the 11th floor, which afforded a really great view over SoHo. The location is really excellent. It's so nice to slip straight out the door into such a vibrant neighbourhood. The staff were excellent. The doormen were extremely attentive and there was one woman on reception, who was particularly professional. The bar is cool and they serve nice cocktails, and the design of the room is very pleasing. On the negative side, the breakfasts are only so-so rather than excellent. The choice is pretty limited and the price a little steep. The other thing I found quite strange was the fact that there was not a desk in my room. I can not be the only traveller, who has work to do while I'm in New York. I mean, it is a city with business travellers... not a spa or a resort. So, I thought it was pretty weird that I had to sit uncomfortably with my computer on my bed. I inquired and was told that there were only desks in the suites. The other big problem I had during my stay was a very poor Internet connection. At times, I actually had to sit on the floor near the door just to get reception! I asked them if guests regularly experienced problems and they said "No". Given the pluses at 60 Thompson, I'd almost definitely give them the benefit of the doubt and return on my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating, friendly, great bars!”
Reviews.Author: heyheyu
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend with friends for my birthday. The visit started shaky when I was not able to present the manager with a Comp Voucher that I didn't realized I needed. Staff stayed calm, let me work through what I needed to do. And then in the end did what they needed to do to help me have a great weekend. Loved the friendliness of the staff. Roof top bar - gorgeous, Thom Bar lots of fun and Kittichai amazing! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “This must be one of the best hotels in NY”
Reviews.Author: ClaireMScotland
Reviews.Content: After reviewing what seemed like hundreds of hotels for our NY trip, we decided upon 60 Thompson - and we're so glad we did. It must be one of the best in NY and I would definitely recommend it. All the staff couldn't do enough for us - the doormen were always friendly and concierge/reception staff also always helpful and friendly. We tipped the doormen/concierge/housekeeper when they helped us with things (~ $10 each time), but I believe this is the norm for NY, so it didn't seem strange. I could rave on and on about this hotel, but it really is an amazing hotel in a really good area. I agree it is a typical hipster nouveau trendy hotel, and slightly (not "vastly") over-priced, but I think you get what you pay for and at 60 Thompson, attention to detail and customers was spot on throughout our week long stay, which means more to me than paying less for sub-standard service. The rooftop bar is lovely - the perfect setting for a cocktail or two after a long day shopping, and the restaurant was also very good. I'm not a huge thai food fan, but it really was good. The only niggle I had while I was there is the first room we were given was really noisy - direcly above the bar (which, incidentally is a lovely cozy, comfortable place), but we asked to be moved and no sooner had we asked, we were moved to a higher floor which had a larger, brighter room with a better view. I believe this may have been a superior room, but we weren't charged any more than originally quoted. Oh, a niggle of my husband's is the mosquito bites he received while sitting next to the trees in the bar at the front of the hotel, although this isn't really the hotel's problem. If you are considering staying in this hotel, ignore any negative reviews and go for it - you won't be disappointed. ps - we had no problems with the air con! pps - really good restaurant Antique Garage around the corner on Mercer Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location, with staff who make me feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: jmignonac
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice on a merry-go-round US trip trip last month and loved every minute of my experience. The rooms were stylish and modern, with all the extras you would want in a hip hotel. Located in the heart of Soho, i couldn't have asked for a better location to hit all of my favorite downtown shops and restaurants. The staff were particularly gracious and welcoming, especially the pretty Avery Bock who's Front of House for the evenings activities; Steven Jacoby, one of the many great doormen; and

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: charkleroad
Reviews.Content: The good 1. Friendly staff: Most of the people we encountered were polite and helpful. I mean the staff at the front entrance, front desk and the restaurant. 2. We like the location. It is in a neighborhood setting. Within walking distance to restaurants, cafes and shops. 3. Restaurant: good food and service. The Bad 1. When we checked in, we were shown our room. Everything looked fine. However, when we came back from dinner, the room was FULL of SMOKE. We hurried to the front desk to tell them that someone smoked in our room. They said they will send a supervisor to inspect and they will let us know. Nobody came back to explain what might have caused the smoke:( 2. A few friends met with us in the lobby/lunge area. My husband moved 2 chairs closer to us so we could chat with each other. A woman (blond) came over with stoned face to tell us we were not allowed to move the chairs.
